newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH NOVO GROUP APPLIES FOR BROKERS LISTING.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH NOVO GROUP APPLIES FOR BROKERS LISTING.

text.p: Finnish information technology firm Novo Group said on Monday it would apply for a listing on the Helsinki bourse's Brokers' list and reported January-March profit after financial up 58 percent at 8.4 million markka.

"The company is today delivering to the Helsinki Stock Exchange a listing application, according to which efforts will be made to start the listing of Novo Group Oy's shares on the brokers' list on July 21, 1997," Novo Group said in a statement.

Once it obtains a listing on the brokers' list, Novo plans to carry out a directed share issue and then to obtain a listing on the main bourse list, but the board has not yet formally decided on a share issue or further listing, it said.

"Novo Group is specialised in comprehensive information technology services: hardware, software and various support services related to the construction and management of the information technology environment," Novo Group said.
The Helsinki based company was known as KT-Tietokeskus until May 1, 1997. It had 1996 net sales of 1.14 billion markka and an average of 938 employees, Novo Group said.
Its January-March earnings per share rose to 1.0 markka from 0.5 markka in the year ago period, and full-1996 earnings per share were 6.7 markka, up from 3.8 in 1995, Novo said.
In 1996, group profit after financial items was 47.3 million markka, up from 26.5 million a year ago, it said.
State-owned bank Postipankki Oy has agreed to make a market in Novo Group shares and the bank will also serve as the group's adviser and main arranger for the listng, Novo Group said.
